description.en: The course examines various legal and political aspects of the United Nations. First, we review the historical experience of the League of Nations, and study why and how states established the United Nations. Then, we explore different topics and activities of the United Nations such as legal status, structure, membership, financing, conflict prevention and peace operations, sanctions, development and self-determination, human rights and humanitarian assistance, immunity and responsibility and reform proposals.
description.et: Kursus käsitleb Ühinenud Rahvaste Organisatsiooni õiguslikke ja poliitilisi aspekte. Esmalt tutvume Rahvaste Liiga ajaloolise kogemusega ning uurime, miks ja kuidas riigid asutasid ÜRO. Seejärel tegeleme lähemalt erinevate ÜRO teemade ja tegevustega nagu õiguslik olemus, struktuur, liikmelisus, finantseerimine, konflikti ennetamine ja rahuoperatsioonid, sanktsioonid, areng ja enesemääramine, inimõigused ja humanitaarabi, immuniteet ja vastutus ning reformide ettepanekud.

objectives.en: To provide a comprehensive understanding of the history, purposes, structure, practice and challenges of the United Nations with an emphasis on legal aspects
objectives.et: Anda mitmekülgne arusaam Ühinenud Rahvaste Organisatsiooni ajaloost, eesmärkidest, struktuurist, praktikast ja väljakutsetest, pöörates erilist tähelepanu õiguslikele aspektidele

learning_outcomes.en: The student who has passed the course:
— Outlines the history of the United Nations and recognises the role of the organisation in world politics
learning_outcomes.et: — Esitab Ühinenud Rahvaste Organisatsiooni ajaloo olulisemad sammud ja mõistab organisatsiooni rolli maailma poliitikas

learning_outcomes.en: — Explains the purposes and functioning principles of the organisation
learning_outcomes.et: — Selgitab organisatsiooni eesmärke ja toimimise põhimõtteid

learning_outcomes.en: — Describes the structure of the organisation, and how the organisation and its specialised agencies are functioning
learning_outcomes.et: — Kirjeldab organisatsiooni struktuuri ning kuidas organisatsioon ja selle spetsialiseeritud asutused toimivad

learning_outcomes.en: — Points out the fields where the organisation is active, and judges what has been achieved and where the progress is lagging
learning_outcomes.et: — Toob välja valdkonnad, kus organisatsioon tegutseb, ning hindab, millistes valdkondades on saavutatud edu ja millistes on vajakajäämisi

learning_outcomes.en: — Identifies political and legal arguments used in discussions, and comprehends the decision-making processes in the organisation
learning_outcomes.et: — Eristab diskussioonis kasutatavaid poliitilisi ja õiguslikke argumente ning mõistab organisatsioonis toimuvaid otsustusprotsesse

notes.en: The course is based on independent learning, supported by pre-recorded lectures and various study materials. Students can follow the course at their own pace, and study anytime and anywhere they have access to internet. No face-to-face or online sessions take place. Possible timeslots in the schedule are for planning and administrative purposes. The course instructor is available for comments and consultations.

independent_work.en:
— Write a research paper where the student analyses critically select aspects of the United Nations and its activities in the light of international law.
— The selected topic must be registered via Moodle (using the messaging function) no later than on 11 November. The instructor may ask the student to choose another topic if the chosen topic is not suitable or someone has already chosen the same problem. The paper must be submitted electronically as a Word-file no later than on 9 December at 1200 (noon) via Moodle. For every started overdue day, the result will be decreased by three points, but papers which are late more than four days are not accepted and the student may not take the exam. The instructor does not consider papers sent by email.
— The paper must include title page, table of content, main body and list of used materials. For references, use footnotes. The length of main text (starting from the introduction and ending with the conclusion, excluding footnotes) should be 2500-3000 words. Shorter papers are not accepted or the result is lowered by the discretion of the instructor.
— Independent identification of clear issues and legal problems is very important. Also, the use of different sources and supportive materials. All used sources must be referred to. In case of internet sources, the full address is necessary, not only the main domain (for example, www.un.org). A paper based on copy-paste method leads to negative results for both the paper and the exam. Plagiarism is not tolerated at the University of Tartu.

grade_preconditions.en: Timely submission and positive evaluation of the research paper

grade_evaluation.en:
— Research paper (40 points)
— Written exam with two questions (60 points)

A.en: Answers to theoretical questions are remarkable; the examination of hypothetical cases is full, logical and creative; the analysis of legal problems is detailed and innovative; all relevant norms and principles have been used; the references to state and court practice are thoughtful and creative; the form is excellent; overall, the text is a remarkable achievement (91-100 points)

B.en: Answers to theoretical questions are very good with insignificant mistakes or omissions; the examination of hypothetical cases is purposeful and creative; the analysis of legal problems is very good with insignificant deficiencies; necessary norms and principles have been used; the references to state and court practice support the conclusions; the form is very good; overall, the treatment of the subject is logical and smooth (81-90 points)

C.en: Answers to theoretical questions are good, but there are mistakes or omissions; the examination of hypothetical cases addresses correctly the central issues; the analysis of legal problems is good with some deficiencies concerning specific issues; key norms and principles have been used; the form is good; overall, the coverage of the subject is logical, but there are some weaknesses from the point of view of the whole (71-80 points)

D.en: Answers to theoretical questions are fair, but there are several mistakes or omissions; the examination of hypothetical cases is satisfactory, but focuses only on the central aspects; the analysis of legal problems is satisfactory with deficiencies is most aspects; only basic norms and principles have been used; the form is fair; overall, the treatment of the subject is plausible, but insecure (61-70 points)

E.en: Answers to theoretical questions are poor with significant mistakes or omissions; the examination of hypothetical cases is weak and limited only to the very basic aspects; the analysis of legal problems is shallow with significant deficiencies is most aspects; only some rudimentary norms and principles have been used; overall, the coverage of the subject suffers of superficial treatment, poor knowledge of law and unsound presentation (51-60 points)
